decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved drawings and documents: C-2020-877-PR-DRW-0001 Rev 2 University of West London Site Location Plan; C-2020-877-PR-DRW-0002 Rev 0 Existing Plan View and Elevations Sheet 1 of 3; C-2020-877-PR-DRW-0003 Rev 0 Existing Plan View and Elevations Sheet 2 of 3; C-2020-877-PR-DRW-0004 Rev 0 Existing Plan View and Elevations Sheet 3 of 3; C-2020-877-PR-DRW-0008 Rev 0 Proposed Boreholes Plan View and Elevations; C-2020-877-PR-DRW- Rev 0 Proposed GSSHIP Plantroom Plan View; C-2020-877-PR-DRW-0009 Rev 1 UWL Existing GSHP Plantroom Plan View & Service Road Elevation; C-2020-877-PR-DRW-0018 Rev 0 UWL Proposed GHSP Plantroom Plan View & Service Road Elevation; SI/PLAN/P-21-971 Cover Letter prepared by Vail Williams dared 29 July 2021; Planning Statement prepared by Vail Williams dated July 2021; NIBE F1345 Ground Source Heat Pump prepared by NIBE; Route 45 From Ground to Heat Pump prepared by MuoviTech; University of West London St Mary's Road Campus prepared by University of West London dated 23 April 2021

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | The materials to be used for the development shall be in accordance with the materials stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies D3 & D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and Ealing Green Conservation Area Management Plan. | Prior to the use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
description: Installation of 34no. boreholes with total peak equals to 467kW to support installation of 15no. 60kW NIBE 1345 Ground Source Heat Pumps (GSHPs) within existing basement boiler room, providing a total 900kW load (part retrospective)
